intro: Meladendron chilense, commonly known as the Chilean meladendron, is a flowering plant native to South America, particularly Chile. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its woody stems, palmate leaves, and showy, five-petaled flowers that bloom in spring. It thrives in temperate climates and is often found in coastal and mountainous regions. Due to its ornamental value, it is cultivated in gardens and botanical collections.
